generation

Class Wall

  • java.lang.Object
    • generation.Wall

  • public class Wall
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic class to describe a wall which is located at a cell (x,y) and at that cell it is located in a particular direction. One can compute the location of a neighboring cell, however that location is only valid for internal wall, i.e. if the neighboring cell is inside the maze. It is used to hold wall coordinates for Prims Maze Generation and for the logging mechanism.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructor, values have same effect has setWall(x,y,cd).

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CardinalDirection getDirection()
      Provides the direction for the wall with regard to the internal position (x,y).

      Computes the x coordinate of neighboring (adjacent) cell for internal walls.

      Computes the y coordinate of neighboring (adjacent) cell for internal walls.
      int getX()
      Get the x coordinate for the current (x,y) position.
      int getY()
      Get the y coordinate for the current (x,y) position.

      Pick a random position (x,y) and a random direction within the given limits and assign these values to this wall.
      void setWall(int x, int y, CardinalDirection cd)
      Sets the internal fields to the given values for a (x,y) position and direction

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wall

        public Wall(int x,
            int y,
            CardinalDirection cd)
        Constructor, values have same effect has setWall(x,y,cd).
        Parameters:
        x - is the x coordinate, 0 <= x < width
        y - is the y coordinate, 0 <= y < height
        cd - is the direction of wall in the cell

    • Method Detail

      • setWall

        public void setWall(int x,
                    int y,
                    CardinalDirection cd)
        Sets the internal fields to the given values for a (x,y) position and direction
        Parameters:
        x - is the x coordinate, 0 <= x < width
        y - is the y coordinate, 0 <= y < height
        cd - is the direction

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Get the x coordinate for the current (x,y) position.
        Returns:
        the x coordinate

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Get the y coordinate for the current (x,y) position.
        Returns:
        the y coordinate

      • setRandomly

        public void setRandomly(int width,
                        int height)
        Pick a random position (x,y) and a random direction within the given limits and assign these values to this wall.
        Parameters:
        width - such that 0 <= x < width
        height - such that 0 <= y < height

      • getNeighborX

        public int getNeighborX()
        Computes the x coordinate of neighboring (adjacent) cell for internal walls. If the wall is a border wall to the outside, then the resulting value is out of range as the cell does not exist.
        Returns:
        the x coordinate of adjacent cell

      • getNeighborY

        public int getNeighborY()
        Computes the y coordinate of neighboring (adjacent) cell for internal walls. If the wall is a border wall to the outside, then the resulting value is out of range as the cell does not exist.
        Returns:
        the y coordinate of adjacent cell

      • getDirection

        public CardinalDirection getDirection()
        Provides the direction for the wall with regard to the internal position (x,y).
        Returns:
        the direction of this wall with regard to its cell location
